title: Episode 534 - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Primary source for episode details including title, air dates, production credits, plot summary, character appearances, debuts, and trivia. This is the most comprehensive single source for episode 534 information.

title: List of One Piece episodes (seasons 15–19) - Wikipedia
author: Wikipedia Contributors
notes: Used to verify episode number, air dates, and season information for episode 534 within the context of Season 15.

title: One Piece season 15 - Wikipedia
author: Wikipedia Contributors

title: 534-535: The Ryugu Palace in Shock! The Kidnapping of Shirahoshi!
author: Never Watched One Piece
notes: Detailed episode analysis providing plot breakdowns, character analysis, and thematic discussion. Particularly useful for understanding the generational conflict between Hachi and Hody Jones.

title: Hody Jones - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Character profile used to verify Hody Jones's ideology, motivations, alliance with Vander Decken IX, and role in episode 534.

title: Vander Decken IX - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Character profile and devil fruit information, particularly details about the Mato Mato no Mi and how Decken uses it in episode 534.

title: Mato Mato no Mi - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Comprehensive information about the Mark-Mark Fruit's abilities, limitations, and how it functions. Critical for understanding the attack on Hachi in episode 534.

title: Shirahoshi - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Character profile providing backstory about Shirahoshi's ten-year imprisonment, her relationship with her mother Queen Otohime, and her identity as Ancient Weapon Poseidon.

title: Otohime - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Information about Queen Otohime's life, assassination, ideals, and her awareness of Shirahoshi's power as Poseidon. Essential for understanding the emotional weight of the Sea Forest scenes.

title: Jinbe/History/During and After the Timeskip - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Jinbe's timeline during the Fish-Man Island arc, including his presence at Queen Otohime's grave and his meeting with Luffy and Shirahoshi.

title: We Go! - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
notes: Information about the opening theme 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani, confirming it was used for episodes 517-578 including episode 534.

title: Music of One Piece - Wikipedia
author: Wikipedia Contributors
notes: Confirmed that ending themes were omitted from episode 279 onwards and not reinstated until episode 1071, meaning episode 534 had no ending theme.

title: Fish-Man Island Arc - One Piece Wiki
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors

title: One Piece: Why Fish-Man Island Is Far More Important Than You Think

title: Why Hody Jones is one of the greatest villains in the One Piece franchise
